Manager – Energy Sourcing & Renewables
description:
To contribute to the expansion of SLR’s Energy \\& Emissions Excellence team in Europe, and to deliver tangible sustainability and decarbonisation outcomes to SLR’s clients, we are looking for new colleagues.


**The team**

The Energy \\& Emissions Excellence (EEE) team, part of SLR’s Energy Advisory practice, provides advisory and implementation support services to energy offtakers, developers and investors. The role is part of a European wide team that collaborates across offices in Europe (and globally) on a daily basis.


With a strong track record of working with multinational organisations, the team delivers business value and impact to clients by advising on and realizing desired outcomes on energy economics, energy security, and emission management across clients’ operations and supply chains. The transition levers addressed include energy management, electrification, renewables, low\\-carbon fuels \\& feedstocks, green heat, low\\-carbon fleet, carbon sinks as well as waste\\-to\\-energy. In Europe, the priority sectors include food \\& beverage, consumer products, life sciences, metals \\& materials, chemicals, glass \\& ceramics, paper \\& pulp, and automotive.


The team supports clients from strategy to execution, tailoring services to where they matter most:


* **“Insight \\& foresight”** on carbon footprints, regulation \\& compliance, technologies \\& solutions, and market developments;
* **“Strategy \\& planning”** for target \\& ambition setting, business \\& operating model change, value chain evolutions, technology choices, investment planning, and roadmap \\& program design;
* **“Solution \\& commitment”** including asset concept design, energy system modelling and optimization, energy procurement, solution costing, business case approval, funding, and supplier \\& contract evaluation;
* **“Execution \\& realization”** including tender management, capital raising, and owner’s engineer activities;
* **“Transformation”** such as stakeholder management, change management, capability sourcing, organisation \\& governance change, digitisation, and program management.

**The role**
------------

As a Manager Energy Sourcing \\& Renewables, you take a key role in growing the services and team related to energy sourcing and renewables across Europe and across sectors from business development to project delivery, and practice development.


You advise clients on the following key areas:


* **Energy Sourcing \\& Procurement Strategy** :



	+ Provide intelligence and foresight on markets and regulation, covering an outlook on e.g. price scenarios, grid fees, taxes, market structures, reporting requirements, protocols, and European energy policy \\& regulatory changes.
	+ Formulate and implement tailored energy sourcing strategies across multiple European markets, balancing cost management, decarbonization, and security of supply across different horizons (short to long term).
	+ Identify opportunities for tariff optimization, load management and contract restructuring.
	+ Assess value potential and define strategy to valorize flexibility (storage, demand side management, curtailment) and the role of electricity procurement in its realization.
* **Renewables \\& Power Purchase Agreements (PPAs)** :



	+ Assess and define renewables sourcing targets in context of frameworks such as SBTi, RE100, CDP and others.
	+ Evaluate renewables sourcing instruments and options in each market/ jurisdiction, advise on the optimal mix today and in the future, and define corresponding renewable roadmaps.
	+ Lead the full lifecycle of renewable energy tenders (on\\-site, off\\-site and vPPAs): defining requirements, preparing RFPs/RFQs, evaluating suppliers, and managing selection processes.
	+ Support clients to structure, negotiate, and close corporate PPAs covering different pricing models, underlying scope (wind, solar, possibly co\\-located storage), and innovative contracting aspects.
	+ Advise on renewable certificate and carbon offset management.
* **Risk Management \\& Budget Oversight** :



	+ Advise on the energy risk management model (price volatility, regulatory shifts, supplier dependencies) and provide recommendations on hedging strategy and instruments.
	+ Strengthen (digital) capabilities to monitor, analyse, forecast and report on energy expenditures and performance against budget at the portfolio level, including energy \\& sustainability reporting needs.
* **Transformation \\& Digital Enablement** :



	+ Translate strategies into required operating model changes to enable their execution, covering processes, organization and governance, (digital) capabilities, data \\& insights. This includes sourcing external capabilities, e.g. through aggregators or flexibility service providers.
	+ Evaluate operating model options on value potential, risk sharing, and implementation cost, and design optimal operating model.
	+ Drive stakeholder alignment and effective change management.
	+ Advise on software capabilities, vendor selection, optimal stack, and integration of 3rd party software capabilities in the Energy Trading \\& Risk Management (ETRM) domain.

Around this scope of activities, you assume following key responsibilities:


* **Business \\& client development** :



	+ Evaluate client needs and market evolutions to identify client opportunities and potential new services.
	+ Support initial conversations with new target clients by providing expertise, sharing project experiences, and qualifying opportunities.
	+ Lead the development of (part of) the proposals related to your scope of activities.
	+ Build relationships at existing clients and on existing projects in order to identify and convert cross\\-selling opportunities.
* **Project delivery:**


	+ Lead projects or workstreams end\\-to\\-end covering project planning, progress management, risk \\& issue management, and project financials.
	+ Build trusted relationships with client stakeholders, manage stakeholder expectations, lead project communication, and perform change management.
	+ Lead the delivery process by defining the methodology and approach, guide the team on task execution, own the project deliverables and client recommendations, and oversee the work performed by Consultants and Analysts.
	+ Facilitate client workshops and steering group meetings.
* **People development:**


	+ Provide daily on\\-the\\-job coaching to project teams.
	+ Provide regular feedback to team members.
	+ Support recruiting of new talent through CV screening \\& interviewing and facilitate onboarding of new hires.
	+ Drive engagement and sense of belonging across the wider EEE team, and support talent retention actions.
	+ Line manager and mentor for Consultants and Analysts, and act as a role model.
* **Practice development:**


	+ Support the development of new offerings (e.g. multi\\-buyer PPA, flexibility proposition).
	+ Drive continuous improvement of methodologies, frameworks, and deliverables.
	+ Support the codification and management of (new) knowledge, and develop and conduct training programs.
	+ Conduct competitive assessments to improve our positioning and differentiation.
	+ Support definition and execution of a team hiring and development plan.

The role is based in Brussels.


The closing date for applications is 31 December 2025\\.


**About us**
------------

SLR are global leaders in Sustainability Solutions, helping our clients achieve their sustainability goals. We are a consultancy with 4000\\+ employees across 6 regions in over 125 countries. Our ‘one team’ culture is at the heart of our business, providing a collaborative and supportive environment for professional development.


Along with competitive salaries, our staff enjoy a comprehensive benefits package including company pension and a structured career framework with regular reviews offering outstanding opportunities for progression. We offer flexible, agile and hybrid working with minimum 50% presence in the office which enables staff to tailor hours worked around core hours, with family friendly policies help balance the needs of professional and home life.  

  



**About you**
-------------

* You hold a University degree (Master’s/PhD) in environmental sciences, engineering, business or economics.
* You have a minimum 6 years of professional experience in energy sourcing \\& procurement or related advisory, particularly within renewables and PPAs.
* You have a demonstrated track record of managing energy portfolios, defining renewable roadmaps and/or negotiating energy/renewables contracts.
* You have experience executing, managing, designing and/or improving energy procurement processes, covering bid management, contracting, scheduling, nomination and settlement. Experience managing external aggregators, flexibility service providers and balancing responsible parties is a plus.
* You have prior (in\\-house) consultancy experience and proven consulting skillset in terms of problem solving, structuring, synthesis, storyboarding, and deliverable production.
* You are proficient with energy data and tools for analysis, forecasting and simulation. Experience using or implementing leading ETRM tools is a plus.
* You have excellent facilitation, communication and stakeholder management skills.
* You have negotiation and contracting skills, especially for tenders and on\\-site or off\\-site PPAs, is a plus.
* You are fluent (min C1\\-level) in English and in at least one of the following languages: German, Dutch, or French, both written and spoken.
* You are self\\-motivated, collaborative, able to work in international, cross\\-functional teams.
* You are motivated to join our Energy \\& Emissions Excellence team in Brussels and contribute to a collaborative and supportive environment.
* You are open to occasional travel within Europe.

**Culture \\& Inclusion at SLR**
-------------------------------

We are committed to being an equal opportunities employer, and our expectations go beyond purely complying with legislation. Through our Regional C\\&I Committees, Global Council and Employee Networks, we foster an inclusive environment where all people regardless of their background can thrive.


We welcome applications from all individuals, regardless of their background, including those from groups that are currently under\\-represented at SLR, such as people identifying as 2SLGBTQI\\+, Indigenous peoples, ethnic minority groups, women, and people with visible or invisible disabilities, including those who are neurodivergent.


Should you require any special adjustments throughout the recruitment process with us, please let us know. As a Disability Confident Committed employer, we seek to ensure all applicants have equitable support when applying to SLR.


***SLR Commitment*** *– All applicants with a disability who meet the essential requirements for the job will be guaranteed an interview in line with our Disability Confident Committed status*

title: Business Analyst Optimisation
description:
Publicatiedatum: 10 december 2025
Brussels
Contract open\\-end
Drive the future of energy optimisation through smart analysis and strategic impact

  

Within Luminus, our Optimisation department is responsible for maximizing the value of the company’s energy assets—such as renewable generation and storage—by leveraging data and market insights to drive efficient, sustainable operations. The department plays a key role in supporting the transition to clean energy by optimizing production and trading strategies that reduce CO₂ emissions and promote the use of green energy.

  

As a Business Analyst for Optimisation, you play a key role in shaping the digital evolution of our energy trading and optimisation landscape. You connect business ambition with IT capabilities, ensuring that every transformation delivers measurable value and drives strategic growth.

  

What you’ll do

  



* Analyse the current optimisation processes and systems, capture the impact of upcoming regulatory changes (e.g. Elia), and translate this into clear requirements.
* Act as the bridge between business (traders, risk, generation) and IT, ensuring business needs are currectly understoord and delivered.
* Coordinate reporting demands within the optimisation team: gather needs, define priorities and align with BI colleagues.
* Document AS\\-IS and TO\\-BE processes, providing structure, transparency and clear impact analysis.
* Drive workshops and stakeholder discussions to clarify requirements, build busienss cases and ensure aligment.
* Safegaurd solution quality and user acceptance from intitial analysis through testing and implementation.
* Support change management: communicate clearly, train business users and facilitate adoption so changes bring real value.

  

What you bring

  

* You hold a Master’s degree in a quantitative field like Finance, Engineering, or Economics.
* You have at least 3 years of experience in business analysis and requirement gathering.
* You understand financial instruments (forwards, swaps, options) and have strong affinity with the energy (trading) sector.
* Experience with ETRM portfolio modelling is a plus.
* You’re experienced with Agile delivery (Scrum, JIRA, Confluence) and business process modelling.
* You bring analytical skills and a data\\-driven mindset, with experience in data analysis considered a plus.
* You take ownership, communicate clearly with diverse stakeholders and keep askign the right questions until things are clear.
* You are fluent in English, and in Dutch or French.

  

Why join us

  

* You’ll be at the heart of Luminus’ strategic transformation, driving innovation in a fast\\-evolving energy market.
* You’ll collaborate with passionate experts across departments, from trading to data science.
* You’ll grow in a dynamic environment that values your insights and empowers you to shape the future.
* You work and connect with your colleagues at a Luminus office or from home. Need some flexibility? Your manager is open to discuss what works.

  

What you'll get in return ?

  

The energy sector is one of the most rewarding industries in Belgium with a highly rewarding compensation and benefits package:


* Competitive compensation: Attractive salary with a performance\\-based bonus that can be optimized to your personal preferences, plus meal vouchers.
* Insurance \\& social benefits: Group insurance and hospitalization coverage for the entire family. Additional reimbursement for healthcare and pharmaceutical costs.
* Mobility: Full reimbursement for public transport, kilometer\\-based cycling reimbursement and flexible mobility choices: you can choose between a company car or mobility budget.
* Internet \\& communication: Home internet covered, reimbursement for a personal mobile device with a phone subscription.
* Home Office: A fully\\-equipped home office, including an ergonomical ICT set\\-up.
* Exclusive discounts: 30% off gas and electricity after six months, discounts on energy\\-saving services (e.g., solar panels, heat pumps) and reduced prices on top brands, amusement parks, festivals and more.

  

Curious about your benefits and more? Visit our jobsite.

  

Luminus values e.v.e.r.y individual.

  

Are you looking for a workplace where you can truly be yourself, where you feel respected, supported regardless of your background, identity and unique story? Then you’ve come to the right place. Diversity equity and inclusion are not empty words for us — we grant that everyone can flourish and feel valued, so let’s build it together!

  



What does that mean in practice?


Do you have specific needs or require adjustments during the recruitment process or once you are hired? Let’s discuss about it and we’ll do our best to find a solution. We can also discuss if you want to work at 80% or 100%.

  

Together we make the difference

title: Risk Manager, ERM
description:
The Opportunity:

Company, Department: Emera Inc, Enterprise Risk Management
Location: Halifax, NS
Closing Date: January 5, 2026  

Reporting to the Senior Director, Enterprise Risk Management, the Risk Manager will require good judgment, initiative, curiosity, conﬁdentiality, and the ability to meet deadlines in a fast\\-moving and often highly sensitive environment. Furthermore, you will need to provide strong leadership and customer support to an internal and external customer base that is remote from your location. Periodic travel is a requirement of the position.


Key elements of this role include::
* Supporting the operating companies as they manage their commodities portfolios. This would include analyzing deal structures, determining and facilitating any management approvals pursuant to various company policies and procedures.
* Administer regular risk meetings, including overseeing agendas and preparing/organizing meeting materials.
* Monitoring for adherence to internal policies and authorization limits, and, as necessary, ensuring any issues are duly investigated and reported on.
* Assisting with market risk and credit questions from the operating companies as well as in the negotiation of master agreements, for the purchase and sale of physical commodities and ﬁnancial products.
* Analyzing and evaluating counterparty creditworthiness and transactional credit requirements.
* Creating, maintaining, and updating databases, ﬁles and records related to risk \\& credit processes and approvals in a manner that is suﬃcient to be shared amongst Middle Office staﬀ and meets applicable internal and external compliance standards, including SOx.
* Acting as a champion for the Company’s ETRM system, Allegro.
* Preparing and presenting reports for various committees.
* Establishing procedures and providing training to personnel on the Policy and associated practices.
* Supporting Emera and/or its Aﬃliate Enterprise Risk Management activities as required.
* Acting as a direct manager to an Analyst.


These skills will make you successful::

To thrive in this role, you recognize yourself in most of the following competencies and skills listed below:* Eight or more years of experience as an analyst or in a related role.
* An undergraduate degree in Finance, Accounting, Business, or a related ﬁeld of study.
* Strong understanding and application of MS suite of tools.
* Strong relationship and communication skills as well as excellent multi\\-tasking abilities.
* Someone who thrives in a fast paced, often stressful work environment.
* Needs to take initiative in building and maintaining customer relationships
* Open minded and ﬂexible in adapting to change and adopting new software applications as well as be a strong team player.

  

We understand that experience comes in many forms, and we’re dedicated to adding new perspectives to the team. So, if your experience is close to what we’ve listed above, please consider applying.
Learn more about our culture and values:

At the Emera Group of Companies, you’ll be part of an inclusive, respectful workplace where everyone is welcomed and supported. Come build a career as unique as you are: making an impact from Atlantic Canada to the world. Your experience and perspective will help us to safely deliver cleaner, more reliable energy to our customers.  

If working in an innovative environment, challenging yourself, and shaping a cleaner energy future inspires you, we want to hear from you. Apply by January 5, 2026 and let us know why this role is right for you.
The perks of joining our team? We offer::
* **Flexibility**: Hybrid work model.
* **Health \\& Wellbeing**: A comprehensive benefits plan, 24/7 access to virtual health care services for you and your family through Dialogue, access to a free on\\-site fitness centre, Employee and Family Assistance Program, parental leave top\\-up plan and wellness benefits.
* **Grow Your Career**: Opportunities to advance within and between our affiliate companies, a focus on employee development and available sponsored education programs.
* **Community Engagement \\& Care**: Corporate investments in the places where our people live and work, mentoring opportunities, fundraising\\-matching and; volunteer programs, various committees and employee resource groups, and scholarships for children of employees.
* **Competitive Compensation**: Short\\-term incentive plan and a Defined Contribution Pension Plan.


Diversity, Equity \\& Inclusion at Emera:

As one of Atlantic Canada’s largest publicly traded companies, we are ranked one of Canada’s Top 100 Employers, Top Employers for Young People and Top Diversity Employers. We know our success is driven by our dedicated teams and we strongly encourage applications from all qualified candidates, including persons who identify as racially visible, Indigenous, persons with disabilities, women in underrepresented roles and members of the 2SLGBTQ\\+ community.  

Applicants from these equity groups may self\\-identify through the online application process. We support candidates and employees with access and accommodation needs and encourage you to let us know when you require accommodation.
Recruitment \\& Promotion Policy:

The success of the Emera Company is driven by its people: a strong team with a shared commitment to support the Emera Company mission and values. The purpose of our recruitment policy is to provide a consistent framework to support fair and equitable attraction, hiring, and retention of the best talent for vacant positions. We are dedicated to maintaining a fair hiring process that provides equitable opportunities to all our applicants and is guided by our company values.

title: Manager Market Risk & Analytics
description:
**Manager Market Risk \\& Analytics**  

Location: Calgary Head Office
  

Job status: Full Time Permanent  

Department: Commodity Risk Management


Is this position safety sensitive: No

  

At Gibson, we believe our competitive advantage lies in the strength and talents of our employees. That means connecting our employees to rewarding careers, building a high\\-performance culture where collaboration and creativity are rewarded, and providing real growth opportunities for employees to take on new challenges.

 **The Role**


Reporting to the Director, Commodity Risk Management, the Manager, Market Risk leads a high\\-performing team, champions market risk capability development, and serves as the face of Market Risk. This role drives advanced data analytics, positioning the team as a centre of excellence for business intelligence. This role will integrate best\\-practice market risk reporting through interactive dashboards that visualize positions, exposures, MTM, and economic P\\&L. Additionally, this role will oversee the transformation and upgrade of Gibson's ETRM platform, RightAngle, ensuring strong governance and developing subject matter experts to enable more advanced risk analytics.

 **What You Will Do**


As the Manager, Market Risk, you will:

* Align with the Gibson Way values and will be responsible for developing and mentoring team members, and providing guidance and direction for the overall group, including:
	+ Managing performance of individuals to achieve results.
	+ Building a collaborative, innovative team to exceed customer expectations (internal and external).
	+ Communicating the Company’s vision and strategy in relatable terms.
	+ Creating an environment of engagement for team members to produce high quality services.
* Lead, mentor, and develop a high\\-performing Market Risk team; provide vision, coaching, and training on risk management concepts and practices, and act as the primary representative for Market Risk, collaborating with front and back office to support assets and business strategy.
* Champion the adoption of advanced analytics and technology—including PowerBI, R, Python, SQL, and DAX—to enable citizen development, enhance risk reporting, and oversee the design, development, and maintenance of BI applications, dashboards, and data warehouse solutions.
* Integrate best\\-practice market risk reporting, including interactive dashboards for physical positions, new deals, price exposures (fixed\\-price and basis risk), and economic value (MTM, P\\&L, and P\\&L attribution).
* Act as the functional lead for risk on the RightAngle ETRM transformation and upgrade, steering the development of enhanced book structures, pricing processes and nomenclature, building test cases, and developing superusers.
* Collaborate cross\\-functionally with Front, Middle, and Back Office teams to ensure accurate valuation, reporting, compliance, and robust controls, governance, and audit\\-ready processes for all risk management activities.
* Analyze internal and external market data, create explanatory visuals, and present findings to the front office, senior management, and the board.
* Drive continuous improvement initiatives, process automation, and technology integration.
* Demonstrates a personal commitment and proactive approach to Environment, Health \\& Safety (EH\\&S) through participation in all applicable EH\\&S programs and ensures safe operation of the branch, team or unit and compliance with all Company EH\\&S policies and procedures.
* May perform other duties as assigned.

 **What You'll Bring to The Role**

* Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Economics, Mathematics, Engineering, Accounting, Data Analytics, or a related quantitative discipline.
* 10\\+ years of experience in energy trading, market risk, or middle office roles, with direct leadership and team development responsibilities
* Professional designations such as ERP (Energy Risk Professional), FRM (Financial Risk Manager), CFA, or CPA would be an asset.
* Experience leading technology\\-driven transformation initiatives, including data governance, ETRM upgrades and BI development, would be an asset.
* Background in financial reporting, regulatory reporting, and audit frameworks would be an asset.
* Demonstrated expertise in market risk modeling, analytics, and reporting, including option models, volatility measures, stress testing, and scenario analysis.
* Advanced proficiency in Excel and business intelligence tools (PowerBI, SQL, R, Python, DAX).
* Experience with ETRM systems (RightAngle preferred) and developing process enhancements.
* Proven ability to communicate complex risk concepts to diverse audiences, including executive leadership, risk committees and boards.
* Ability to manage cross\\-functional projects in a fast\\-paced highly collaborative environment.

 **Working Conditions**

* This job is subject to background checks as outlined in Gibson Energy’s Background Checks policy. Background checks may include: employment history verification, reference checks, education and/or credentials verification, credit check and a criminal history check.

 **Why You’ll Love Working at Gibson**

  

For over 70 years, Gibson has been defined by our people — those who seize opportunities and make exceptional customer service a part of everything we do. Working at Gibson is an opportunity to be part of a place where employees feel valued, supported and motivated to do their best work. Here’s what sets us apart:

* **A competitive Total Rewards package** that truly values your contributions.
* **Employer contributions to your DC Pension** because we believe in your future.
* **Comprehensive health, dental \\& vision benefits**, with industry leading coverage for mental health and family planning — ensuring you and your loved ones thrive.
* **Generous time off** to rest, recharge and live life to the fullest.
* **An incredible work environment and culture** where your career development and advancement are prioritized every step of the way.
* **A flexible hybrid work setup**, empowering you to balance work and life seamlessly.

  

Gibson Energy Inc. (“Gibson” or the “Company”) is a diversified North American energy infrastructure company headquartered in Calgary, Alberta. They have significant terminal assets, including 25 million barrels of storage and over 300 miles (500 kilometres) of crude pipelines across North America. The company has been providing market access to the oil and gas industry for over 70 years and is publicly traded on the Toronto Stock Exchange (TSX:GEI) with a market capitalization of approximately $4 billion.

  

Gibson Energy operates through two main segments:

* **Infrastructure:** This includes terminals, marine loading, rail loading and unloading facilities, gathering pipelines, a diluent recovery unit, and a crude oil processing facility. Key facilities within this segment include the Hardisty, Edmonton, and Ingleside Terminals, as well as gathering pipelines in the United States and a crude oil processing facility in Moose Jaw, Saskatchewan.
* **Marketing:** This involves the purchasing, selling, storing, and optimizing of hydrocarbon products.

  

Gibson Energy has a strong presence in the United States, due to the acquisition of the Gateway Terminal in Ingleside, Texas. This terminal is a world\\-class liquids terminal and export facility with very large crude carrier (VLCC) capabilities and direct pipeline connections to key basins like the Permian and Eagle Ford. The acquisition strengthens Gibson's cash flow with over 95% of the revenue under take\\-or\\-pay contracts with high\\-quality counterparties.

 **Our Values, The Gibson Way**

  

The Gibson Way is how we succeed together. We believe in the power of both **‘We’** (collectively working together) and **“I”** (contributing individually) to achieve our shared goals.

 **The ‘We \\& I’ play a very important role in our success!**

* Contribute \\& Add Value Everyday
* Keep Our Edge \\& Be Resilient
* Stay Focused \\& Open\\-Minded
* Work it Out \\& Do it Together

  

This is what we are all about and we encourage you to learn more! Click Here: **The Gibson Way**

  

For more information, visit **www.gibsonenergy.com**.
company_description: Gibson Energy is a leading crude oil infrastructure company that connects customers to markets, employees to rewarding careers, and investors to long-term value.

title: Manager Digital Delivery
description:
Joining Suncor means you will work for one of the best companies in Canada, providing tremendous future potential where talented people thrive and lead. As our business evolves, so do our employment opportunities. Our work culture includes a dynamic mix of professionals, with a diversity of skills and expertise.
Are you looking for a new opportunity to take on a leadership role here at Suncor? In this role, the Manager of Digital Business Solutions is responsible for driving transformation and innovation across Suncor's Supply Trading and Optimization (ST\\&O) group. In this role, you will lead the development, implementation, and optimization of digital platforms, process, reporting and stewardship across ST\\&O.
Minimum Requirements:* Bachelor's degree in a technical field like Computer Science, Engineering, or Mathematics
* 10\\+ years’ experience in leadership roles within (and with exposure to) energy trading, financial services, or commodity markets
* 8\\+ years managing or senior roles in large\\-scale digital transformation initiatives to support to energy trading, financial services, or commodity markets
* Proven track record of implementing or supporting ETRM (Energy Trading and Risk Management) systems and trading platforms
* Deep understanding of energy commodity markets, trading processes, and regulatory requirements
* Strong business acumen with ability to translate complex technical concepts into business value
* Excellent stakeholder management and communication skills for senior executive engagement
* Project management expertise with experience leading complex, multi\\-year technology implementations

  

Responsibilities:* Lead evaluation, selection, and implementation of business solutions
* Oversee enterprise\\-wide digital initiatives that enhance competitive advantage and operational efficiency of ST\\&O and ST\\&O internal partners
* Design and implement integrated technology solutions that bridge front\\-office trading with middle and back\\-office operations
* Lead development of real\\-time data analytics and business intelligence capabilities for enhanced market visibility and decision support
* Oversee integration of multiple data sources, trading platforms, and risk management systems into cohesive digital ecosystem
* Build and lead high\\-performing digital business solutions teams including product owners, business analysts, process analysts, project managers, scrum masters, citizen developers and technology specialists

  

Location and other key details:* This is an office\\-based role. You will work out of our Calgary head office, located in the Suncor Energy Centre at 150 – 6th Ave S.W.
* Hours of work are a regular 40\\-hour work week, Monday to Friday
* Our business professional roles follow internal compensation guidelines, and the pay band will generally be based years of experience and scope of work


Why Suncor?  

Suncor's operations include oil sands development, production and upgrading; offshore oil and gas; petroleum refining in Canada and the U.S.; and the company's Petro\\-Canada retail and wholesale distribution networks (including Canada's Electric Highway™, a coast\\-to\\-coast network of fast\\-charging electric vehicle stations).
With a strong strategy for growth and our long\\-standing approach to sustainability, operational excellence, capital discipline and technology and innovation, Suncor offers a solid foundation for you to continue building your career. We offer rewarding opportunities for you to learn, contribute and grow in a variety of career\\-building positions – all of which means tremendous potential for your future. We are focused on deepening our commitment to inclusion and diversity and creating a respectful workplace.
We are an equal opportunity employer and encourage applications from all qualified individuals. We are committed to providing a diverse and inclusive work environment where every employee feels valued and respected. We have numerous employee inclusion networks to help foster an inclusive and respectful culture and drive positive change within Suncor. Current networks include both workplace inclusion networks (focusing on inclusion and respect for all), and identity\\-focused networks (focusing on building community and a sense of belonging and allyship). Through the Journey of Reconciliation, we are progressing the way we think and act to build greater mutual trust and respect with the Indigenous Peoples in Canada. Please note we will consider accessibility accommodations to applicants upon request.

title: Energy Trader
description:
Berkshire Hathaway Energy (BHE) Canada is a Canadian subsidiary of Berkshire Hathaway Energy focused on identifying and investing in business opportunities related to all aspects of the energy infrastructure market across Canada. BHE Canada currently owns and operates a 130 MW wind farm, a 20 MW natural gas\\-fired power plant, and a high voltage transmission line in Alberta. BHE Canada is headquartered in Calgary, Alberta.

In January 2025, BHE Canada launched AlbertaEx, a power marketing affiliate created to optimize our generation and transmission portfolio and drive commercial growth. AlbertaEx is seeking an Energy Trader to join our expanding 24/7 trading team. This role is integral to optimizing our asset portfolio, expanding market presence, and supporting our entry into the Western Energy Imbalance Market (WEIM).

Reporting to the Manager, Power Marketing, the Energy Trader will execute trading strategies across Alberta and the Pacific Northwest electricity markets, schedule and tag physical flows, manage market bidding and compliance, and develop analytics to support commercial decision\\-making. This position operates on a rotating day/night shift schedule to ensure continuous market coverage.

**RESPONSIBILITIES**

* Negotiate and execute approved trading strategies across Alberta and broader WECC power markets
* Maximize commercial value from a diverse portfolio of assets located in Alberta and Montana, including wind, solar, energy storage, natural gas, and firm transmission rights
* Schedule and tag power flows across multiple markets, actively managing real\\-time operational constraints, market volatility and changing system conditions
* Manage bid and offer submissions in AESO, WEIM, and other applicable markets, ensuring accuracy and compliance with market rules
* Build and maintain short\\-term price forecasting models and market analytics to support real\\-time and forward trading strategies
* Develop and maintain strong relationships with counterparties, customers, and utilities to enhance deal flow, expand market access, and reinforce AlbertaEx’s reputation for professionalism and reliability.

**QUALIFICATIONS**

* Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Engineering, Economics, Mathematics, or a related field; an advanced degree would be an asset
* Experience trading and scheduling physical power in Alberta and/or WECC markets
* Strong understanding of energy market conditions.
* Proficiency with trading platforms and analytical tools, such as Energy Trading and Risk Management (ETRM) systems, tagging platforms, and ICE\\-NGX.
* Strong analytical skills in quantitative analysis and spreadsheet modelling.
* Ability to work in a fast\\-paced trading environment with a rotating shift schedule.
* Communication and negotiation skills to develop industry contacts, negotiate outcomes, and close on opportunities.
* Strong organizational and time management skills.
* Proven track record of good performance and attendance.

**Notes:**

External candidates can submit their application via Indeed at https://ca.indeed.com/cmp/BHEC/jobs or by searching BHE\\- Canada jobs.

BHE Canada Ltd. employees should be aware that we may contact your manager during the selection process. Some positions may require job specific assessments, regular criminal record checks, additional BHE Canada Ltd. training, medical assessments, annual drivers abstract, and drug tests. Please contact the Hiring Manager or Recruiter for further clarification if required.

We thank all candidates for their interest in a career with BHE Canada Ltd., however, only candidates being considered for an interview will be contacted.

When you submit a job application to BHE Canada Ltd., it will be accessible to BHE Canada Ltd. personnel involved in BHE Canada Ltd.’s hiring processes and the information will be used for recruitment. In addition, BHE Canada Ltd. relies on qualified third parties to assist in the hiring process and your information may be provided to them for this purpose. By submitting your job application, you agree to the use of your personal information for these purposes.

At BHE Canada Ltd. we celebrate diversity and inclusion. We are committed to fair employment practices, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment regardless of race, religious beliefs, colour, gender, gender identity, gender expression, physical disability, mental disability, age, ancestry, place of origin, marital status, family status, source of income, sexual orientation or any other category protected by applicable provincial or federal law.

Job Type: Full\\-time

Benefits:

* Casual dress
* Company events
* Company pension
* Dental care
* Disability insurance
* Employee assistance program
* Extended health care
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Tuition reimbursement
* Vision care
* Wellness program

Ability to commute/relocate:

* Calgary, AB T2P 3G6: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (preferred)

Application question(s):

* Do you have experience trading and scheduling physical power in Alberta and/or WECC markets?

Work Location: In person

title: Director of Marketing
description:
**DESCRIPTION**

Inatech (a subsidiary of Valsoft) is seeking a dynamic, data\\-driven, and strategic Head of Marketing to lead the company’s global marketing strategy across the energy, oil \\& gas, and commodities sectors. The role will be pivotal in shaping brand positioning, driving lead generation, supporting enterprise sales growth, and enhancing market visibility for Inatech’s suite of intelligent cloud\\-based energy trading risk management (ETRM) and fuel management solutions. This is a fully remote leadership position, reporting directly to the CEO, and working closely with the Head of Business Development and Product teams.


**ABOUT INATECH**

Inatech is a global pioneer in intelligent cloud\\-based energy trading risk management and fuel management solutions. We leverage the deep industry expertise and knowledge of the world’s largest commodity trader — building a strong foundation for innovation and problem\\-solving. Our heritage lies in a vertically integrated business model spanning production, refining,


marketing, trading, and retail of energy products. We serve value chains across the energy and fuel markets with scalable, decision\\-support systems that help customers stay ahead of the competition while maximizing investment outcomes.


**ABOUT VALSOFT CORP.**

Established in Canada in 2015, Valsoft has grown into a global portfolio of 113\\+ software companies. It specializes in acquiring and developing vertical market software firms and nurturing them to be leaders in their industries. Valsoft invests for the long term, partnering with management teams to drive sustainable growth and innovation.


**CULTURE**

At Inatech, we believe people are our greatest assets. We foster a culture of innovation, collaboration, and continuous learning — where every individual has a voice and the opportunity to make a tangible impact. We Dream Big, Stay Humble, and Stay Hungry.

**POSITION DESCRIPTION**

The Head of Marketing will be responsible for developing and executing a comprehensive marketing strategy to position Inatech as a global leader in the energy and commodities software market. The role involves brand building, demand generation, digital marketing, content strategy, and market intelligence to support enterprise sales and product growth.


You will work cross\\-functionally to align marketing initiatives with sales, product, and corporate objectives — creating a unified go\\-to\\-market approach that drives visibility, engagement, and pipeline growth.


**Requirements**

**KEY RESPONSIBILITIES**

**Strategic Leadership**

* Develop and execute Inatech’s global marketing strategy in alignment with business goals and sales objectives.
* Position Inatech as a thought leader in ETRM, marine fuel management, and energy technology segments.
* Partner with the CEO and sales leadership to shape go\\-to\\-market (GTM) initiatives.

**Brand \\& Communications**

* Strengthen the company’s global brand identity through consistent messaging and visual representation.
* Oversee corporate communications, public relations, and digital presence across all channels.
* Manage media relationships and coordinate industry event participation, webinars, and speaking engagements.

**Demand Generation \\& Digital Marketing**

* Drive inbound and outbound lead generation campaigns across digital platforms (LinkedIn, Google, industry portals, etc.).
* Optimize marketing funnels and lead\\-nurturing processes in collaboration with sales.
* Manage marketing automation tools and CRM systems (HubSpot, Salesforce, Zoho, etc.).

**Content \\& Product Marketing**

* Lead content development — case studies, whitepapers, blogs, videos, and customer success stories.
* Collaborate with product teams to translate complex software oƯerings into market\\-relevant value propositions.
* Develop sales enablement assets (pitch decks, solution briefs, demos, etc.) for the global sales team.

**Market Intelligence \\& Analytics**

* Conduct competitive and market analysis to guide pricing, positioning, and go\\-to\\-market decisions.
* Define key marketing KPIs and use data\\-driven insights to continuously improve performance.

**Leadership \\& Team Development**

* Build and lead a high\\-performing global marketing team with expertise across content, digital, and communications.
* Manage external agencies, creative vendors, and PR partners to deliver measurable outcomes.

**QUALIFICATIONS \\& EXPERIENCE**


* 10–15 years of progressive experience in B2B SaaS marketing, with at least 5 years in a leadership role.
* (Strong) experience in the energy, oil \\& gas, commodities, or trading technologysectors.
* Proven ability to build and scale marketing programs that drive enterprise software sales.
* Demonstrated success in demand generation, brand management, and digital marketing in a global setting.
* Hands\\-on experience with CRM, marketing automation, and analytics tools (HubSpot, Salesforce, Google Analytics, etc.).
* Exceptional storytelling, communication, and stakeholder management skills.
* Experience collaborating with cross\\-border sales and product teams.

**PREFERRED SKILLS**

* A good understanding of the downstream oil business and related software markets.
* Strong analytical mindset with comfort using metrics to inform strategy.
* Experience organizing or representing brands at global energy and trading conferences.
* Creative, self\\-driven, and highly adaptable to a fast\\-paced, entrepreneurial environment.

**COMPENSATION**

* Attractive base salary with performance\\-based incentives.

**Benefits**


EMPLOYEE PERKS


* Remote\\-first, global working environment.
* High\\-growth company with an entrepreneurial culture.
* Opportunity to make a measurable impact on a global SaaS business.
* Direct exposure to executive leadership and strategic decision\\-making.

Are you ready to join a collaborative and innovative team where you can make an


immediate impact?

title: Rotational Analyst, 2026 Leadership Development Program
description:
**Our Company**  

ION is the world’s most progressive FinTech company providing pioneering software and consultancy services to customers around the globe. We serve large financial institutions, trading firms, central banks, and corporations. We are committed to automating processes that positively impact our customers’ work and provide insights to enable more informed decision making. We provide software and data to our customers to simplify complex processes and digitize their businesses. Our products and services help the world's leading organizations do more, in a better and simpler way than ever before.  

  

ION software underpins the global fixed income, foreign exchange, and derivatives markets, powers the world’s central banks, and enables the automation of workflows across critical treasury and commodities operations for thousands of companies worldwide. ION data and analytics are the golden source for M\\&A, equity, and leverage finance bankers worldwide. With a dynamic team of 13,000\\+ employees, in 40\\+ global offices, and 5,000\\+ customers worldwide, ION provides an unparalleled career experience for those who share our passion for growth and technology evolution.  

ION Group consists of the following divisions:* ION Analytics: Provider of investment banking M\\&A, equity and debt data, analytics, and content
* ION Commodities: Provider of energy and commodities trading and risk management solutions
* ION Markets: Provider of workflow solutions that automate the complete trade lifecycle and deliver actionable insights in real\\-time
* ION Treasury: Provider of unique treasury and risk management solutions that help clients manage liquidity of any scale while mitigating operational, financial, and reputational risk

 **Our Program**  

Our Leadership Development Program (LDP) is a foundational global initiative focused on developing talent for ION’s growing operations around the world. The program provides an opportunity for outstanding university graduates to start a career in a dynamic and fast\\-paced global FinTech firm.  

Analysts will spend the first 18 months of their career in 3 diverse, 6\\-month rotations covering a broad range of ION's core capabilities. At the end of their 3 rotations, analysts will transition to a deeper dive in one area of ION. Sample rotations / deep dives include:* Product Management
* Client Support
* Consulting and Delivery Services
* Sales and Account Management

  

Analysts will spend their first rotation contributing through a role in their home office. However, analysts may have the opportunity to spend their second or third rotations in another location.

Leadership Development Program analysts will explore various roles across multiple ION divisions. LDP has a presence in Toronto, New York, Chicago, Houston, Hong Kong, Singapore, Tokyo, and London.  

  

**What You'll Do**  

As an LDP, you will be working at the forefront of the FinTech industry in teams with fellow analysts and experienced subject matter experts. After going through our thorough induction program, you will quickly be expected to take ownership of challenging projects that make a real difference to our company and our customers. You will gain exposure and extensive skills related to the different areas of ION's capabilities. Throughout the program, you will also be encouraged to pursue interests and skills outside of your rotation to further yourself and the organization. **Highlighted Analyst Projects*** Conducted a strategic assessment of sales and trading workflows for a global investment bank's fixed income division to help standardize processes, automate manual touchpoints, and improve overall sales efficiency
* Hands\\-on experience deploying ION solutions in real\\-world environments through implementation projects
* Analyzed product usage data to uncover trends and insights that drive decisions
* Translated client requirements into detailed user stories for software development
* Managed technical and commercial relationships for clients' use of ION solutions through understanding of client requirements and goals
* Led product sales campaigns and executed commercial process to expand ION's client base

### **General Responsibilities**

* + Communicate effectively
	+ Prepare internal and client\\-facing presentations and analyses
	+ Take ownership of projects and manage deadlines
	+ Exercise attention to detail in all aspects of performance
	+ Multi\\-task and think critically under pressure
	+ Demonstrate creativity and innovation
	+ Think strategically
	+ Automate to simplify complex processes internally and for our customers

### **Basic Qualifications**

* + Winter 2025 or Spring 2026 undergraduate graduation
	+ 3\\.3/4\\.0 GPA or above (transcript required)
	+ STEM, Business, or Economics degrees preferred, and/or demonstrable interest in finance and/or technology, ideally including work experience
	+ Authorization to work in selected country without restriction or need for sponsorship
	+ Demonstrated leadership potential both in and out of the classroom
	+ Passion for learning, self\\-improvement, and a questioning and challenging mindset
	+ Motivated self\\-starter who is proactive, enthusiastic, and passionate about what they do
	+ Strong problem\\-solving capabilities and the desire to understand the “why” behind each problem
**How You’ll Grow**  

Upon completion of the Leadership Development Program, you will have a well\\-formed view of the FinTech industry. Through the rotational opportunities supported by continuous feedback, coaching, and mentoring, you will develop critical skills and professional capabilities fundamental to your career.  

  

At ION, we encourage our analysts to step outside their comfort zone. The LDP gives analysts the opportunity to identify their passions and cultivate their skills. Our goal is for you to complete the program equipped with sufficient knowledge, and the potential, to become future leaders.  

  

Transitioning into your deep dive role, you will further explore your passions within ION.  

  

Find your passion, build your skills, hone your excellence, and make a difference.  

ION is committed to maintaining a supportive and inclusive environment for people with diverse backgrounds and experiences. We respect the varied identities, abilities, cultures, and traditions of the individuals who comprise our organization and recognize the value that different backgrounds and points of view bring to our business.

ION adheres to an equal employment opportunity policy that prohibits discriminatory practices or harassment against applicants or employees based on any legally impermissible factor.
We may use artificial intelligence (AI) tools to support parts of the hiring process, such as reviewing applications, analyzing resumes, or assessing responses. These tools assist our recruitment team but do not replace human judgment. Final hiring decisions are ultimately made by humans. If you would like more information about how your data is processed, please contact us.

title: Trading Desk Operations Manager
description:
**The position**


Sympower is quickly scaling its flexible asset trading and optimization platform in Europe. Our portfolio includes sizeable BESS projects, corporate \\& industrial demand response programs, and renewable assets, which we optimize across wholesale and ancillary services markets.


Leveraging your experience in asset\\-backed power trading operations and BRP environments, you will lead and grow our backoffice operations, settlements, and invoicing processes. You will ensure accurate and timely settlement of our growing portfolio across multiple markets while building scalable systems and processes. In this function, you will work closely with traders, risk analysts, and finance teams to support our rapid expansion across Nordic countries, Greece, and other European markets.


In this role you will report into the Head of Finance with a matrix report to the Head of Trading and Energy Markets.

**What is in it for you**


We are committed to creating an inclusive, values\\-based culture where everyone feels that they belong and has the opportunity to do meaningful work.


We offer a market competitive compensation package, including but not limited to:

* 30 Days Paid Holiday Leave
* 1 Day Paid Wellness Leave
* 1 Day Paid Birthday Leave
* Paid Maternity and Partner Leave
* Pawternity Leave
* Mental Health and Wellbeing Support
* Remote Office Budget
* Internet Allowance
* Development Plan \\& Budget
* Stock Appreciation Rights
* 2 Days Paid Volunteer Leave


Learn about all of our benefits on our careers page.

**What you will do**

* **Settlement \\& reconciliation**


	+ Lead daily, weekly, and monthly settlement processes for spot, intraday, and balancing markets
	+ Reconcile positions with TSOs, power exchanges, and internal trading systems
	+ Investigate and resolve discrepancies, missing data and disputed charges
	+ Maintain clear documentation, records, and quality checks**BRP Operational support**


	+ Support Balance Responsible Party (BRP) compliance and reporting activities
	+ Ensure portfolio positions are accurately reflected in settlement and reporting
	+ Support interactions with TSOs and external stakeholders when required**Invoicing \\& revenue support**


	+ Prepare and validate invoices for assets, partners and market services
	+ Verify settlement charges, tariffs, and inputs for accuracy
	+ Work closely with Finance on month\\-end close and ensure correct reconciliation to ledgers**Process, Controls \\& Data Quality**


	+ Maintain accurate data for assets, contracts, counterparties, and settlement inputs
	+ Standardize and document all back\\-office workflows to ensure consistency
	+ Perform operational checks to reduce settlement errors and financial risk
	+ Validate meter/production data used in settlement and invoicing
	+ Monitor collateral (Nordpool, eSett) and coordinate with finance on updates
	+ Monitor KPIs and provide clear operational reporting to the business
	+ Identify and support process improvements that enhance accuracy and efficiency**Team work \\& Cross\\-Functional Support**


	+ Act as the primary point of contact for back\\-office operational queries
	+ Collaborate closely with Trading, Risk, Finance, Compliance, and Asset Operations
	+ Provide practical input to tech teams on new tools, systems, and automation opportunities based on back\\-office needs
	+ Support onboarding of new markets, assets, and commercial agreements into existing workflows

* **What you'll need**


	+ Solid experience in European power market settlements, including spot, intraday, balancing and imbalance processes (Nord Pool experience preferred)
	+ Strong accuracy and attention to detail in reconciliation and validation task
	+ Confidence working with numbers, data and structured procedures
	+ Good understanding of market documentation, settlement rules and TSO requirements
	+ Ability to communicate clearly and collaborate with trading, finance, and other internal teams
	+ Organized and reliable working style with a focus on consistency, compliance and deadlines
	+ Positive attitude toward improving existing processes and standardizing back\\-office workflows
	+ Some experience supporting or coaching colleagues in an operations team (formal or informal leadership)

**Beneficial skills**

* Exposure to battery energy storage systems (BESS), flexibility services or ancillary markets
* Familiarity with REMIT or other regulatory reporting duties
* User experience with ETRM or settlement tools
* Experience with exchange or clearing collateral processes (e.g. Nord Pool margins)

**Experience and Education**

* 5\\+ of relevant experience in energy operations, trading back\\-office or similar role with at least 2 years in a senior or team lead capacity
* Good knowledge of European electricity market operations and settlement flows
* Experience with TSOs, power exchanges (ideally Nord Pool) and/or BRP\\-related activities
* Strong numerical accuracy and detail\\-focused working style
* Comfort reconciling operational and financial data  

Clear communication and stakeholder coordination skills
* Bachelor's degree in Finance, Economics, Business Administration, Engineering, or related field
* Professional certifications (CFA, CAIA, PRM) advantageous but not required

**Location**


Teammates for this position are based in Amsterdam, Stockholm or Turku. This role will be asked to work a hybrid arrangement, with approximately 2 days per week in our office.


At Sympower, we believe in fair and transparent pay.


Base pay within the range is ultimately determined by a candidate's skills, expertise, and competence. We have four geographic pay zones. For this role, most employees have the following base pay ranges as new hires in each zone:

* Zone A: €36,000 \\- €58,080
* Zone B: €42,000 \\- €68,640
* Zone C: €53,000 \\- €80,000
* Zone D: €58,000 \\- €91,160


Please visit https://careers.sympower.net/sympower\\-pay\\-transparency for more information on which locations are included in each of our geographic pay zones.

**Who we are**


Sympower is accelerating the global transition towards ‘net\\-zero’ by helping to build smarter, cleaner renewable energy systems. Using our proprietary software platform, we help balance the supply and demand of electricity across international energy networks.


We help businesses, grid operators, asset owners and other energy stakeholders around the world reduce their carbon emissions, integrate more distributed renewable energy resources, and generate new revenue streams by participating in demand\\-side response services.


Learn more about us in this video.


Since 2022, Sympower has been a certified B Corp, which shows the company is meeting high standards of verified performance, accountability, and transparency across 5 impact areas: governance, workers, community, environment, and customers.

*Sympower is an equal opportunity employer. We encourage a diverse workforce and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all team members.*

*Your personal data will be processed in accordance with ou**r* *Privacy Policy**.*

***MESSAGE TO RECRUITMENT AGENCIES: support for filling this position is not required, so proposals for recruitment services will not be reviewed or responded to.***
